abstract: A study of a City Council proposal to increase pay for workers on city-subsidized projects has added fuel to the debate over the measure.
snippet: A study of a City Council proposal to increase pay for workers on city-subsidized projects has added fuel to the debate over the measure.
lead_paragraph: A proposal that would require companies to pay higher wages on city-subsidized projects would result in a loss of jobs, according to the final version of a long-awaited study of the proposal released by the city's economic development agency.

headline.main: Study Says Higher-Wage Bill for City Projects Would Cost Jobs
